verses.kjv: And now, O ye priests, this commandment is for you.
verses.ct: "Now then, priests, this command is directed at you.

verses.kjv: If ye will not hear, and if ye will not lay it to heart, to give glory unto my name, saith the LORD of hosts, I will even send a curse upon you, and I will curse your blessings: yea, I have cursed them already, because ye do not lay it to heart.
verses.ct: If you refuse to listen, and if you won't take it seriously and honor my name," says the LORD of hosts, "then I will send a curse on you, and I will turn your blessings into curses. In fact, I have already cursed them, because you haven't taken it to heart.

verses.kjv: Behold, I will corrupt your seed, and spread dung upon your faces, even the dung of your solemn feasts; and one shall take you away with it.
verses.ct: "Pay attention — I will ruin your offspring, and I will smear the dung from your festival sacrifices on your faces, and you will be hauled away with it.

verses.kjv: And ye shall know that I have sent this commandment unto you, that my covenant might be with Levi, saith the LORD of hosts.
verses.ct: Then you will understand that I sent this command to you so that my covenant with Levi would continue," says the LORD of hosts.

verses.kjv: My covenant was with him of life and peace; and I gave them to him for the fear wherewith he feared me, and was afraid before my name.
verses.ct: "My covenant with him promised life and peace, and I granted these to him because of his deep reverence — he deeply revered me and stood in awe of my name.

verses.kjv: The law of truth was in his mouth, and iniquity was not found in his lips: he walked with me in peace and equity, and did turn many away from iniquity.
verses.ct: Reliable instruction was on his lips, and nothing false was found in what he said. He walked with me in peace and integrity, and he turned many people away from sin.

verses.kjv: For the priest’s lips should keep knowledge, and they should seek the law at his mouth: for he is the messenger of the LORD of hosts.
verses.ct: A priest's words should preserve knowledge, and people should be able to come to him for instruction, because he serves as the messenger of the LORD of hosts.

verses.kjv: But ye are departed out of the way; ye have caused many to stumble at the law; ye have corrupted the covenant of Levi, saith the LORD of hosts.
verses.ct: But you have strayed from that path. Your teaching has caused many to stumble. You have destroyed the covenant with Levi," says the LORD of hosts.

verses.kjv: Therefore have I also made you contemptible and base before all the people, according as ye have not kept my ways, but have been partial in the law.
verses.ct: "So I have made you despised and humiliated in front of everyone, because you have not followed my ways but instead have shown favoritism in how you apply the law."

verses.kjv: Have we not all one father? hath not one God created us? why do we deal treacherously every man against his brother, by profaning the covenant of our fathers?
verses.ct: Don't we all share the same father? Didn't one God create us? So why do we betray each other, violating the covenant of our ancestors?

verses.kjv: Judah hath dealt treacherously, and an abomination is committed in Israel and in Jerusalem; for Judah hath profaned the holiness of the LORD which he loved, and hath married the daughter of a strange god.
verses.ct: Judah has been unfaithful. A disgusting thing has been done in Israel and in Jerusalem — Judah has desecrated what the LORD considers holy, what he loves, by marrying women who worship foreign gods.

verses.kjv: The LORD will cut off the man that doeth this, the master and the scholar, out of the tabernacles of Jacob, and him that offereth an offering unto the LORD of hosts.
verses.ct: May the LORD remove from the community of Jacob anyone who does this — whether leader or follower — even if that person brings offerings to the LORD of hosts.

verses.kjv: And this have ye done again, covering the altar of the LORD with tears, with weeping, and with crying out, insomuch that he regardeth not the offering any more, or receiveth it with good will at your hand.
verses.ct: Here is another thing you do: you flood the LORD's altar with tears, weeping and crying out, because he no longer pays attention to your offerings or accepts them favorably from you.

verses.kjv: Yet ye say, Wherefore? Because the LORD hath been witness between thee and the wife of thy youth, against whom thou hast dealt treacherously: yet is she thy companion, and the wife of thy covenant.
verses.ct: Yet you ask, "Why not?" It's because the LORD stood as witness between you and the wife you married when you were young — the one you have betrayed, even though she is your partner and your wife by covenant.

verses.kjv: And did not he make one? Yet had he the residue of the spirit. And wherefore one? That he might seek a godly seed. Therefore take heed to your spirit, and let none deal treacherously against the wife of his youth.
verses.ct: Didn't God make the two of you one? He still had power of the spirit in reserve. And why did he make you one? Because he was looking for godly children. So guard yourselves carefully, and do not betray the wife you married when you were young.

verses.kjv: For the LORD, the God of Israel, saith that he hateth putting away: for one covereth violence with his garment, saith the LORD of hosts: therefore take heed to your spirit, that ye deal not treacherously.
verses.ct: "I hate divorce," says the LORD, the God of Israel, "and I hate it when someone covers himself with violence like a garment," says the LORD of hosts. "So guard yourselves carefully, and do not be unfaithful."

verses.kjv: Ye have wearied the LORD with your words. Yet ye say, Wherein have we wearied him? When ye say, Every one that doeth evil is good in the sight of the LORD, and he delighteth in them; or, Where is the God of judgment?
verses.ct: You have exhausted the LORD with your words. Yet you ask, "How have we exhausted him?" By saying, "Everyone who does evil is considered good by the LORD, and he takes pleasure in them," or by asking, "Where is the God of justice?"
